FuncDef:
The ptp max-steps-removed command configures the maximum number of hops for a time synchronization device.
The undo ptp max-steps-removed command restores the default configuration.
By default, the maximum number of hops for a time synchronization device is 64.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of hops.
The value is a string of 1 to 255 characters. The default value is 255.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To reduce impacts on synchronization performance after clocks form a loop, run the ptp max-steps-removed command to configure the maximum number of hops for a time synchronization device.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
When the stepsRemoved value in the Announce packets received by a clock source is greater than or equal to the specified maximum number of hops, the clock source is considered unavailable. The maximum number of hops needs to be specified based on the synchronization network scale.
